SWB
SWB - A Modified Thornthwaite-Mather soil-water-balance Code for Estimating Groundwater Recharge

graph.F90

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 module graph
00002 !!****h* SWB/graph
00003 ! NAME
00004 !
00005 !   graph.f95 - Outputs gridded data to a graphics file.
00006 !
00007 ! SYNOPSIS
00008 !   This module creates a DISLIN "3D Color Plot" given a gridded data
00009 !   set.  KML files may also be generated, allowing a time series of
00010 !   image files to be viewed sequentially with Google Earth.
00011 !
00012 !!***
00013 
00014 #ifdef GRAPHICS_SUPPORT
00015 
00016 !  use DISLIN
00017   use dislin
00018   use types
00019   implicit none
00020   save
00021 
00022   contains
00023 
00024   subroutine makegraph(pGraph,pGrd, iVarNum)
00025 
00026     type (T_GENERAL_GRID),pointer :: pGrd      ! Grid of model cells
00027     type(T_GRAPH_CONFIGURATION), dimension(:), pointer :: pGraph
00028     integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iVarNum
00029     real, dimension(pGrd%iNX,pGrd%iNY) :: ZMAT
00030     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iCol,iRow
00031     character (len=256) :: sBuf
00032 
00033     ! [ LOCALS ]
00034 
00035     real :: XA,XE,XOR,XSTEP
00036     real :: YA,YE,YOR,YSTEP
00037     real :: ZA,ZE,ZOR,ZSTEP
00038     real :: rAspectRatio
00039     integer :: iX, iY, iNXW, iNYW, iNXP, iNYP
00040     integer , parameter :: iSZ = 1024    ! base graph size
00041 
00042     integer :: iNumGridCells
00043     character (len=256) :: sPaperSize
00044     real :: rFG_Color
00045     integer :: iBG_Color
00046 
00047     ! establish number of cells in model grid
00048     iNumGridCells = pGrd%iNY * pGrd%iNX
00049 
00050     XA = REAL(pGrd%rX0)
00051     XE = REAL(pGrd%rX1)
00052     XOR = XA
00053     XSTEP = (XE - XA) / 5.
00054 
00055     YA = REAL(pGrd%rY0)
00056     YE = REAL(pGrd%rY1)
00057     YOR = YA
00058     YSTEP = (YE - YA) / 5.
00059 
00060     ZA = REAL(pGraph(iVarNum)%rZA(pGraph(iVarNum)%iTimeFrame))
00061     ZE = REAL(pGraph(iVarNum)%rZE(pGraph(iVarNum)%iTimeFrame))
00062     ZOR = REAL(pGraph(iVarNum)%rZOR(pGraph(iVarNum)%iTimeFrame))
00063     ZSTEP = REAL(pGraph(iVarNum)%rZSTEP(pGraph(iVarNum)%iTimeFrame))
00064 
00065     iX = INT(pGrd%iNX)
00066     iY = INT(pGrd%iNY)
00067 
00068     select case(pGrd%iDataType)
00069 
00070       case(T_INT_GRID)
00071         do iCol=1,iX
00072           do iRow=1,iY
00073             ZMAT(iCol,iRow) = REAL(pGrd%iData((iY-iRow+1),iCol))
00074           end do
00075         end do
00076 
00077       case(T_SGL_GRID)
00078         do iCol=1,iX
00079           do iRow=1,iY
00080             ZMAT(iCol,iRow) = REAL(pGrd%rData((iY-iRow+1),iCol))
00081           end do
00082         end do
00083 
00084       case(T_CELL_GRID)
00085 
00086         call Assert(lFALSE,"graph.f95: unsupported grid type was used in call")
00087 
00088     end select
00089 
00090     write(sBuf,"(a7,f9.2,a9,f9.2,a7,f9.2)") &
00091        "  min: ",minval(ZMAT), &
00092        "   mean: ",sum(ZMAT)/iNumGridCells, &
00093        "  max: ",maxval(ZMAT)
00094 
00095     ! METAFL defines the metafile format.
00096     ! 'PS'     defines a coloured PostScript file.
00097     ! 'EPS'     defines an Encapsulated PostScript file. The format is nearly the same as for 'PS'.
00098     ! 'PDF'     defines a PDF file.
00099     ! 'WMF'     defines a Windows metafile.
00100     ! 'PNG'     defines a PNG file.
00101     ! 'BMP'     defines a Windows Bitmap format.
00102 
00103       CALL METAFL(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV))
00104 
00105     !'USAL'     US paper size A, landscape,  2790 *  2160 points.
00106     !'USAP' US paper size A, portrait, 2160 *  2790 points
00107 !      call SETPAG(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cPAPER_SIZE))
00108 
00109     rAspectRatio = REAL(iX) / REAL(iY)
00110 
00111     ! set paper size for Postscript-based output options
00112     if(rAspectRatio>1.) then
00113       sPaperSize = "USAL"
00114       iNXP = 2790
00115       iNYP = 2160
00116     else
00117       sPaperSize = "USAP"
00118       iNXP = 2160
00119       iNYP = 2790
00120     endif
00121 
00122 !      iNXP = INT(rAspectRatio * REAL(iSZ,kind=T_SGL))
00123     iNXW = iNXP
00124 
00125 !      iNYP = INT((1./rAspectRatio) * REAL(iSZ,kind=T_SGL) * 1.15)
00126       iNYW = iNYP
00127 
00128 
00129 !      write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) "iX: ",iX,"    iY: ",iY
00130 !      write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) "iNXP: ",iNXP, "   iNYP: ", iNYP
00131 !      write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) " "
00132 
00133 !      call PAGE(iNXP,iNYP)
00134 
00135      ! WINSIZ: This routine defines the size of windows and the
00136      ! resolution of DISLIN image formats such as TIFF, PNG, BMP,
00137      ! PPM and IMAGE. By default, the window size is
00138      ! set to 2/3 of the screen size, and the resolution of
00139      ! image formats is 853 x 603 pixels.
00140 
00141     ! A output image filename can be set with SETFIL
00142     call SETFIL(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cSETFIL))
00143 
00144     ! Set options specific to the desired output type
00145     ! ==> LEVEL 0 <==
00146     if(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="PNG") then
00147       ! The routine PNGMOD enables transparency for PNG files.
00148 !       call PNGMOD('ON','TRANSPARENCY')
00149       call PAGE(iNXP,iNYP)
00150       call WINSIZ(iNXW/2,iNYW/2)
00151 
00152     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="PDF") then
00153       call SETPAG(TRIM(sPaperSize))
00154 
00155     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="GIF") then
00156       ! The routine GIFMOD enables transparency for GIF files.
00157       call GIFMOD('ON','TRANSPARENCY')
00158       call WINSIZ(iNXW,iNYW)
00159 
00160     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="WMF") then
00161 
00162     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="TIFF") then
00163       call WINSIZ(iNXW,iNYW)
00164 
00165     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="BMP") then
00166       call WINSIZ(iNXW,iNYW)
00167 
00168     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="PS") then
00169       call SETPAG(TRIM(sPaperSize))
00170 
00171     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="EPS") then
00172       call SETPAG(TRIM(sPaperSize))
00173 
00174     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="SVG") then
00175       call SETPAG(TRIM(sPaperSize))
00176 
00177     endif
00178 
00179     ! WINSIZ: This routine defines the size of windows and the
00180     ! resolution of DISLIN image formats such as TIFF, PNG, BMP,
00181     ! PPM and IMAGE. By default, the window size is
00182     ! set to 2/3 of the screen size, and the resolution of
00183     ! image formats is 853 x 603 pixels.
00184 
00185     !------------------------------------------------------------
00186     ! ** INITIALIZE PLOT - MOVE TO LEVEL 1
00187     !------------------------------------------------------------
00188 
00189     ! DISINI: initializes DISLIN by setting default parameters
00190     ! and creating a plotfile.
00191     CALL DISINI()
00192 
00193     ! ERRMOD: The printing of warnings and the output of the
00194     ! protocol in DISFIN can be disabled with the routine ERRMOD.
00195     if(pGraph(iVarNum)%lEnableDislinMessages) then
00196       call ERRMOD('ALL','ON')
00197     else
00198       call ERRMOD('ALL','OFF')
00199     endif
00200 
00201     ! SETVLT: selects a colour table.
00202     ! 'SPEC'     defines 256 colours arranged in a rainbow where 0 means
00203     ! black and 255 means white. This colour table uses more
00204     ! violet colours than 'RAIN'.
00205     CALL SETVLT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCOLOR_TABLE))
00206 
00207     if(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCOLOR_TABLE)=="RRAIN" &
00208       .or. TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCOLOR_TABLE)=="RGREY" &
00209       .or. TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCOLOR_TABLE)=="RSPEC") then
00210       rFG_Color = 1.
00211       iBG_Color = 255
00212     else
00213       rFG_Color = 1.
00214       iBG_Color = 0
00215     end if
00216 
00217     ! LABELS: The routine LABELS defines contour labels.
00218     CALL LABELS('FLOAT','Z')
00219 
00220     ! LABDIG: Set the number of digits following the decimal place.
00221     CALL LABDIG (2, 'Z')
00222 
00223     ! SETGRF removes a part of an axis or a complete axis from an axis system.
00224     ! The call is:     CALL SETGRF (C1, C2, C3, C4)     level 1, 2, 3
00225     ! or:    void setgrf (char *c1, char *c2, char *c3, char *c4);
00226     ! The parameters can have the values
00227     ! 'NONE', 'LINE', 'TICKS', 'LABELS' and 'NAME'.
00228     call SETGRF('LINES','LINES','LINES','LINES')
00229 
00230     ! Set options specific to the desired output type
00231     ! ==> LEVEL 1 <==
00232     if(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="PNG") then
00233       CALL BMPFNT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cFONT_NAME))
00234       call SETRGB(rFG_Color, rFG_Color, rFG_Color)
00235       CALL PAGFLL(iBG_Color)
00236 
00237     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="PDF") then
00238       CALL PSFONT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cFONT_NAME))
00239 
00240     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="GIF") then
00241       CALL HWFONT()
00242 !           call COLOR('YELLOW')
00243 
00244     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="WMF") then
00245       CALL WINFNT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cFONT_NAME))
00246 !           call COLOR('YELLOW')
00247 
00248     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="TIFF") then
00249       CALL BMPFNT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cFONT_NAME))
00250 !           call COLOR('YELLOW')
00251 
00252     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="BMP") then
00253       CALL BMPFNT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cFONT_NAME))
00254 !           call COLOR('YELLOW')
00255 
00256     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="PS") then
00257       CALL PSFONT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cFONT_NAME))
00258 
00259     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="EPS") then
00260       CALL PSFONT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cFONT_NAME))
00261 
00262     elseif(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cCDEV)=="SVG") then
00263       CALL PSFONT(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cFONT_NAME))
00264 
00265     endif
00266 
00267     ! COLOR defines the colours used for plotting text and lines.
00268 
00269 
00270     ! PAGERA: plots a border around the page.
00271 !      CALL PAGERA()
00272 
00273     ! TITLIN: This subroutine defines up to four lines of
00274     ! text used for axis system titles. The text can be
00275     ! plotted with TITLE after a call to GRAF.
00276 
00277     ! populate second line of title
00278     CALL TITLIN(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cTITLE),2)
00279     ! populate fourth line of title
00280     CALL TITLIN(sBuf,4)
00281 
00282     CALL NAME(TRIM(pGraph(iVarNum)%cZ_AXIS_TITLE),'Z')
00283 
00284     ! AUTRES: With a call to AUTRES, the size of coloured rectangles
00285     ! will be automatically calculated by GRAF3 or CRVMAT.
00286     CALL AUTRES(iX,iY)
00287 
00288     ! CENTER:  center the axis system on the page
00289     call CENTER()
00290 
00291     ! The routine GRAF3 plots a 3-D axis system where the
00292     ! Z-axis is plotted as a colour bar.
00293     CALL GRAF3(XA, &
00294                XE, &
00295                XOR, &
00296                XSTEP, &
00297                YA, &
00298                YE, &
00299                YOR, &
00300                YSTEP, &
00301                ZA, &
00302                ZE, &
00303                ZOR, &
00304                ZSTEP)
00305 
00306     ! CRVMAT: plots a coloured surface according to a matrix
00307     CALL CRVMAT(ZMAT,iX,iY,2,2)
00308 
00309     ! HEIGHT: defines the character height.
00310     CALL HEIGHT(50)
00311 
00312     ! TITLE: places the title text onto the page
00313     CALL TITLE()
00314 
00315     CALL DISFIN()
00316     return
00317 
00318   end subroutine makegraph
00319

00321 
00322   subroutine make_shaded_contour(pGrd, sOutputFilename, sTitleTxt, sAxisTxt)
00323 
00324     type (T_GENERAL_GRID),pointer :: pGrd      ! Grid of model cells
00325     character (len=*) :: sOutputFilename
00326     character (len=*) :: sTitleTxt
00327     character (len=*) :: sAxisTxt
00328 
00329     ! [ LOCALS ]
00330     real, dimension(pGrd%iNX,pGrd%iNY) :: ZMAT
00331     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iCol,iRow
00332     character (len=256) :: sBuf = ""
00333     character (len=256) :: sSummaryTxt = ""
00334     real (kind=T_SGL) :: rH_V_AspectRatio
00335     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iPixVRes = 600.
00336     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iPixHRes
00337 
00338     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iPtVRes
00339     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iPtHRes
00340     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iPtVOrigin
00341     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iPtHOrigin
00342     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iPtVAxLen
00343     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iPtHAxLen
00344 
00345     ! EXPLANATION OF DISLIN VARIABLES
00346     ! XA, XE        :: lower and upper limits of the X-axis.
00347     ! XOR, XSTP     :: first X-axis label and the step between labels.
00348     ! YA, YE        :: lower and upper limits of the Y-axis.
00349     ! YOR, YSTP     :: first Y-axis label and the step between labels.
00350     ! ZA, ZE        :: lower and upper limits of the Z-axis.
00351     ! ZOR, ZSTP     :: first Z-axis label and the step between labels.
00352 
00353     real :: XA,XE,XOR,XSTEP
00354     real :: YA,YE,YOR,YSTEP
00355     real :: ZA,ZE,ZOR,ZSTEP
00356 
00357     integer :: iX, iY, iNXW, iNYW
00358     integer (kind=T_INT) :: iNumGridCells
00359 
00360     ! establish number of cells in model grid
00361     iNumGridCells = pGrd%iNY * pGrd%iNX
00362 
00363     XA = REAL(pGrd%rX0)
00364     XE = REAL(pGrd%rX1)
00365     XOR = XA
00366     XSTEP = (XE - XA) / 5.
00367 
00368     YA = REAL(pGrd%rY0)
00369     YE = REAL(pGrd%rY1)
00370     YOR = YA
00371     YSTEP = (YE - YA) / 5.
00372 
00373     iX = INT(pGrd%iNX)
00374     iY = INT(pGrd%iNY)
00375 
00376     ! determine page size in PIXEL dimensions
00377     rH_V_AspectRatio = REAL(pGrd%iNX) / REAL(pGrd%iNY) ! + 0.2  ! add extra for colorbar
00378     iPixHRes = INT(REAL(iPixVRes) * rH_V_AspectRatio)
00379 
00380     ! determine page size in POINT dimensions; for some reason DISLIN seems to like
00381     ! larger values to work with, therefore we multiply by 4
00382     iPtHRes = iPixHRes * 4
00383     iPtVRes = iPixVRes * 4
00384 
00385     iPtVOrigin = INT(REAL(iPtVRes) * 0.97)
00386     iPtHOrigin = INT(REAL(iPtHRes) * 0.03)
00387 
00388     iPtVAxLen = INT(REAL(iPtVRes) * 0.82)
00389     iPtHAxLen = INT(REAL(iPtHRes) * 0.82)
00390 
00391     select case(pGrd%iDataType)
00392 
00393       case(T_INT_GRID)
00394 
00395         if(minval(pGrd%iData) <= 0 .and. maxval(pGrd%iData) <= 0) then
00396           ZA = maxval(pGrd%iData)
00397           ZE = minval(pGrd%iData)
00398         else
00399           ZA = minval(pGrd%iData)
00400           ZE = maxval(pGrd%iData)
00401         endif
00402 
00403         ZOR = ZA
00404         ZSTEP = (ZE - ZA) / 10.
00405 
00406         do iCol=1,iX
00407           do iRow=1,iY
00408             ZMAT(iCol,iRow) = REAL(pGrd%iData((iY-iRow+1),iCol),kind=T_SGL_DISLIN)
00409           end do
00410         end do
00411 
00412       case(T_SGL_GRID)
00413 
00414         if(minval(pGrd%rData) <= 0. .and. maxval(pGrd%rData) <= 0.) then
00415           ZA = maxval(pGrd%rData)
00416           ZE = minval(pGrd%rData)
00417         else
00418           ZA = minval(pGrd%rData)
00419           ZE = maxval(pGrd%rData)
00420         endif
00421 
00422         ZOR = ZA
00423         ZSTEP = (ZE - ZA) / 10.
00424 
00425         ! flip array up-down
00426         do iCol=1,iX
00427           do iRow=1,iY
00428             ZMAT(iCol,iRow) = pGrd%rData((iY-iRow+1),iCol)
00429           end do
00430         end do
00431 
00432       case(T_CELL_GRID)
00433         call Assert(lFALSE,"graph.f95: unsupported grid type was used in call")
00434       end select
00435 
00436       write(sSummaryTxt,"(a,f9.2,a,f9.2,a,f9.2)") &
00437         "  min: ",minval(ZMAT), &
00438         "  mean: ",sum(ZMAT)/iNumGridCells, &
00439         "  max: ",maxval(ZMAT)
00440 
00441       ! METAFL defines the metafile format
00442       CALL METAFL("PNG")
00443 
00444       ! The routine PNGMOD enables transparency for PNG files.
00445 !       CALL PNGMOD('ON','TRANSPARENCY')
00446 
00447       ! A output image filename can be set with SETFIL
00448       call SETFIL(TRIM(sOutputFilename))
00449 
00450       ! The routine FILMOD determines if a new plot file name is
00451       ! created for existing files.
00452       CALL FILMOD('DELETE')
00453 
00454       ! PAGE determines the size of the page.
00455       call PAGE(iPtHRes,iPtVRes)
00456 !       call SETPAG('da4p')
00457 
00458       ! Allow scaling up to full page size
00459       CALL SCLMOD('FULL')
00460 
00461       ! DISINI initializes DISLIN by setting default parameters and creating a plotfile.
00462       CALL DISINI()
00463 
00464       ! The printing of warnings and the output of the protocol in DISFIN
00465       ! can be disabled with the routine ERRMOD.
00466       call ERRMOD('ALL','ON')
00467 
00468       ! This routine defines the size of windows and the resolution of
00469       ! DISLIN image formats such as TIFF, PNG, BMP, PPM and IMAGE.
00470       ! By default, the window size is set to 2/3 of the screen size,
00471       ! and the resolution of image formats is 853 x 603 pixels.
00472       call WINSIZ(iPixHRes,iPixVRes)
00473 
00474 !      call axspos (iPtHOrigin, iPtVOrigin)
00475 !      call ax3len (iPtHAxLen, iPtVAxLen, iPtVAxLen)
00476 
00477       ! COLOR defines the colours used for plotting text and lines.
00478       call COLOR('YELLOW')
00479 
00480       ! SETVLT selects a colour table.
00481       ! 'SPEC'  defines 256 colours arranged in a rainbow where 0 means
00482       ! black and 255 means white. This colour table uses more
00483       ! violet colours than 'RAIN'.
00484       CALL SETVLT('SPEC')
00485 
00486 !     CALL HELVES()
00487       CALL DUPLX()
00488 !      CALL SHDCHA()
00489 
00490       ! The routine LABELS defines contour labels.
00491       CALL LABELS('FLOAT','Z')
00492       CALL LABDIG (2, 'Z')
00493 
00494       ! SETGRF removes a part of an axis or a complete axis from an axis system.
00495       ! The call is:  CALL SETGRF (C1, C2, C3, C4)  level 1, 2, 3
00496       ! or: void setgrf (char *c1, char *c2, char *c3, char *c4);
00497       ! The parameters can have the values
00498       ! 'NONE', 'LINE', 'TICKS', 'LABELS' and 'NAME'.
00499       call SETGRF('LINES','LINES','LINES','LINES')
00500 
00501       ! With a call to AUTRES, the size of coloured rectangles
00502       ! will be automatically calculated by GRAF3 or CRVMAT.
00503       CALL AUTRES(iX,iY)
00504 
00505       CALL PAGERA()
00506 
00507       CALL NAME(TRIM(sAxisTxt),'Z')
00508 
00509       ! HEIGHT defines the character height.
00510       CALL HEIGHT(50)
00511 
00512       CALL TITLIN(TRIM(sTitleTxt),1)
00513       CALL TITLIN(TRIM(sSummaryTxt),3)
00514 
00515     ! The routine GRAF3 plots a 3-D axis system where the Z-axis
00516     ! is plotted as a colour bar.
00517 
00518     ! The call is:     CALL GRAF3 (XA, XE, XOR, XSTP, YA, YE, YOR, YSTP, ZA, ZE, ZOR, ZSTP)     level 1
00519 
00520     ! XA, XE     are the lower and upper limits of the X-axis.
00521     ! XOR, XSTP  are the first X-axis label and the step between labels.
00522     ! YA, YE     are the lower and upper limits of the Y-axis.
00523     ! YOR, YSTP  are the first Y-axis label and the step between labels.
00524     ! ZA, ZE     are the lower and upper limits of the Z-axis.
00525     ! ZOR, ZSTP  are the first Z-axis label and the step between labels.
00526 
00527     CALL CENTER()
00528 
00529     CALL GRAF3(XA, &
00530                XE, &
00531                XOR, &
00532                XSTEP, &
00533                YA, &
00534                YE, &
00535                YOR, &
00536                YSTEP, &
00537                ZA, &
00538                ZE, &
00539                ZOR, &
00540                ZSTEP)
00541 
00542     ! CRVMAT plots a coloured surface according to a matrix
00543     CALL CRVMAT(ZMAT,iX,iY,1,1)
00544 
00545     CALL TITLE()
00546 
00547     CALL DISFIN()
00548     return
00549 
00550   end subroutine make_shaded_contour
00551 
00552 #endif
00553 
00554 end module graph
